-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>

-    <item><![CDATA[La idea s mostrar-vos de nou la fitxa, just abans que la oblideu. Els estudis emprics han demostrat que d\'aquesta forma la informaci significativa es pot aprendre ms eficientment. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Ara sobre la organitzaci i AnkiDroid:<br/><br>Tota la informaci ha d\'estar en parelles de preguntes i respostes. Si voleu aprendre en la direcci contrria, heu de crear una altra fitxa amb la informaci intercanviada. ]]></item>

-    <item><![CDATA[Anem a fer una ullada a la barra superior: <br/><br/> A la cantonada superior esquerra trobareu alguns nmeros. El vermell compta les fitxes fallades (contestades amb un \"De nou\"),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[A la cantonada dreta trobareu informaci sobre el temps que heu estat pensant en aquesta fitxa i sobre el vostre rendiment.]]></item>

-    <item><![CDATA[Vielen Dank fr die Installation von AnkiDroid!<br>Dies ist eine kurze Einfhrung<br><br>Im Moment sehen Sie die <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>Frage</span> einer Karteikarte.<br>Bitte klicken Sie auf die groe Schaltflche unten...]]></item>

-    <item><![CDATA[Die Idee ist, Karten kurz vor dem Vergessen zu prsentieren. Empirische Studien haben gezeigt, dass Informationen auf diese Weise am effizientesten gelernt werden knnen.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Noch einige Worte zur Organisation in AnkiDroid:<br><br>Alle Informationen werden in Frage/Antwort-Paaren erstellt. Wenn in die entgegengesetzte Richtung gelernt werden soll, sollte eine neue Karte mit vertauschten Feldern erstellt werden.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Alle Karten sind in Stapel zusammengefasst und knnen mit Hilfe aller mglichen Schlagworte dort leicht organisiert werden.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Es gibt vor allem zwei Mglichkeiten, neue Karten zu bekommen:<br><br>Entweder, Sie laden fertige Stapel anderer Benutzer herunter (whlen Sie \"Stapel herunterladen\" im Optionen-Men der Stapelbersicht), oder Sie erstellen sie selbst]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Um Stapel aber perfekt nach Ihren Wnschen zu bekommen, ist es vermutlich notwendig, sie selbst zu erstellen. Das kann entweder mit AnkiDroid erledigt werden...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Einen Blick auf die obere Leiste:<br /><br />In der oberen linken Ecke finden sich einige Zahlen. Die rote zhlt die mit \"nochmal\" beantworteten Karten, die schwarze smtlich Karten, die bereits einmal gelernt wurden und heute fllig sind]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[In der oberen rechten Ecke ist die Denkzeit der aktuellen Karten angegeben und Informationen ber die heutige Leistung.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Das waren die Hauptpunkte der AnkiDroid-Benutzung.<br /><br />Fr Weiteres zum Anki-Konzept besuchen Sie http://ankisrs.net]]></item>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[      :<br /><br />       .       (   &quot;&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[                   .]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[                           .<br /><br />       .]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[      ,        .]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Gracias por instalar AnkiDroid!<br />Esta es una breve introduccin.<br /><br />Lo que ves ahora es el lado de la <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>pregunta</span> de una tarjeta.<br />Por favor, haz clic en el botn grande de abajo...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Se muestra ahora la siguiente tarjeta:< br / >< br / >La idea es sencilla: al igual que en tarjetas de papel \"reales\", escribes una pregunta sobre el frente y la respuesta en la parte trasera de tus tarjetas.< br / >< br />(haz click en el botn para mostrar la parte trasera)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[\"Cul es la capital de Burkina Faso?\"<br /><br />Reflexiona un poco sobre la respuesta y luego haga clic en \"Mostrar respuesta\"]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Por encima de cada botn de respuesta, encontrars informacin sobre el tiempo que pasar antes de que la tarjeta se vuelva a mostrar en caso de responder con ese botn.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[La intencin es mostrarte la tarjeta de nuevo, inmediatamente antes de que la olvides. Estudios empricos han mostrado que de este modo la informacin se puede aprender ms eficientemente.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Algunas palabras acerca de la organizacin en AnkiDroid:<br /><br>Toda la informacin tiene que ser presentada en pares de preguntas y respuestas. Si quieres aprender en la direccin inversa, debes crear otra tarjeta con la informacin intercambiada.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Las tarjetas se agrupan en mazos y se pueden organizar con la ayuda de todo tipo de etiquetas.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Existen principalmente dos formas de conseguir nuevas tarjetas:<br /><br />O bien te descargas mazos prefabricados de otros usuarios (elegir la opcin \"Descargar mazo\" en el men de opciones del resumen de mazos), o bien crearlas t mismo.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[En cualquier caso, crear tus propios mazos es esencial para cubrir tus necesidades a la perfeccin. Puedes hacerlo directamente en AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Vamos a echar un vistazo a la barra superior: <br /><br /> En la esquina superior izquierda se encuentran algunos nmeros. El rojo cuenta las tarjetas falladas (contestadas con un \"Otra vez\"),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[En la esquina derecha se encuentra informacin acerca de tu tiempo de reflexion con esta tarjeta, y sobre tu rendimiento.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Estos han sido los principales puntos sobre el uso de AnkiDroid.<br /><br>Para ms informacin sobre el concepto clave de Anki, visita http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... para ver el lado de la <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>respuesta</span> de la tarjeta (por debajo de la lnea).<br /><br /><br />Haz clic en el botn ms a la derecha de los cuatro botones.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Supongamos que deseas aprender las capitales del mundo. Hagamos que la pregunta sea...<br /><br />(haz click en uno de los botones para mostrar la siguiente tarjeta)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[\"Ouagadougou\" es la respuesta correcta.<br /><br />No acertaste? Haz clic en \"Otra vez\" para ver de nuevo la tarjeta en un par de minutos. Si acertaste, haz clic en uno de los botones restantes, dependiendo de la facilidad con la que respondiste.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Este perodo de tiempo se calcula en base a la ltima vez que respondiste a la tarjeta, la facilidad de repuesta actual y facilidad de repuestas anteriores de la tarjeta.]]></item>

-    <item><![CDATA[el negro muestra el nmero de tarjetas que ya habas aprendido antes y que debes repasar hoy, y el nmero azul te dice la cantidad de tarjetas nuevas previstas para hoy. <br /><br /> El tipo al que pertenece la tarjeta actual se especifica mediante un subrayado.]]></item>

- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>

- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Merci d\'avoir install AnkiDroid !<br />Ceci est une courte introduction.<br /><br />Ce que vous voyez maintenant est la partie <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> de la carte-mmoire.<br />Cliquez sur le bouton large ci-dessous pour continuer...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Vous voyez dsormais la deuxime carte-mmoire.<br /><br />L\'ide est simple : comme avec les cartes-mmoire du &quot; monde rel &quot;, vous crivez une question au dessus de la carte et la rponse au dos de la carte.<br /><br />(cliquez sur le bouton pour afficher le dos de la carte)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot; Quelle est la capitale du Burkina Faso ? &quot;<br /><br />Rflchissez un peu  la rponse et cliquez pour &quot; montrer la rponse &quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Sur chacun des boutons de rponse, vous voyez une information sur l\'intervalle de temps au bout duquel la carte sera rpte si vous appuyez sur ce bouton.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[L\'ide est de vous re-montrer la carte juste avant que vous ne l\'oubliez. Des tudes empiriques ont montr que de cette manire, l\'information pouvait tre retenue de la manire la plus efficace.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Quelques mots sur l\'organisation dans AnkiDroid : <br /><br>Toutes les informations  retenir sont  mettre dans des couples questions/rponses. Si vous voulez apprendre dans le sens oppos, crez une autre carte avec les informations inverses.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Les cartes sont organises en paquets et peuvent tre organises par l\'aide de toutes sortes de libells.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Il y a deux manire d\'obtenir de nouvelles cartes :<br /><br />Soit vous tlchargez des paquets tout faits partags par d\'autres personnes (choisissez &quot; Tlcharger le paquet &quot; dans le menu options de l\'cran Tous les paquets) ou bien vous les crez vous mme. ]]></item>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item>

- ~ PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

- ~ this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>
-</resources>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>
-</resources>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[AnkiDroid   ! <br />  .<br /><br />   flashcard<span style=\'font-weight:600;\'></span>. <br />   ... ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[ ... flashcard  <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'></span>   .<br /><br /><br />4     ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>
-</resources>

- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Dankjewel voor het installeren van AnkiDroid!<br />Dit is een korte introductie.<br /><br />Wat je nu ziet is de <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>vragende</span> kant van de flitskaart.<br />Klik op de grote knop hieronder...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Nu wordt de volgende kaart getoont.<br /><br />Het idee is duidelijk: Net zoals bij &quot;echte&quot; papieren flitskaarten, schijf je een vraag op de voorkant en het antwoord op de achterkant van je kaarten.<br /><br />(klik de knop om de achterkant te zien)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Wat is de hoofdstad van Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Denk even over het antwoord en klik dan op &quot;Toon antwoord&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[boven elke antwoord-knop, vind je de tijd waarna de kaart vertoont zal worden, wanneer met deze knop beantwoord.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Het is de bedoeling de kaart te tonen, vlak voordat je het zou vergeten. Empirische studies hebben aangetoond dat op deze manier informatie het meest efficint wordt geleerd. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Een aantal woorden over de organisatie van AnkiDroid:<br /><br>Alle informatie moet in paren van vraag en antwoord worden ingevoerd. Als je wilt leren in de andere richting, zal je een andere kaart moeten maken met de gegevens op de andere zijde.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Kaarten worden bewaard in leersets en kan vandaaruit worden georganiseerd met allerlei tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Er zijn hoofdzakelijk twee manieren om nieuwe kaarten te verkrijgen:<br /><br />Je download kant-en-klare leersets van andere gebruikers  (kies &quot;download leerset&quot; in het menu met opsomming van alle leersets) of maak ze zelf. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Maar, het maken van eigen leersets past het beste bij je eigen leerwensen. Je kan dit doen vanuit AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Bekijk eens de bovenste balk:<br /><br />In de hoek linksboven zie je een aantal nummers. De rode telt het aantal niet-gelukte kaarten (beantwoord met &quot;opnieuw&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[In de rechterhoek zie je informatie over je denktijd voor deze kaart en over je prestatie.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Dit waren de belangrijkste punten om AnkiDroid te gebruiken.<br /><br>Voor meer informatie over het basisidee van Anki, bezoek http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... om de kant met het <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>antwoord</span> te zien (beneden de lijn).<br /><br /><br />Klik op de juiste van de vier knoppen.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Stel, je wilt \'s-werelds hoofdsteden leren. Laat de vraag zijn...<br /><br />(klik op een van de knoppen voor de volgende kaart)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is het juiste antwoord. <br /><br />Je wist het niet? Klik &quot;Opnieuw&quot; om de kaart binnen een paar minuten opnieuw te zien. Anders, klik op de andere knoppen, afhankelijk van je herkenning van het antwoord.]]></item>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>
-</resources>

- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Dzikujemy za zainstalowanie AnkiDroida!<br/>To jest krtkie wprowadzenie.<br/><br/>Tekst, ktry wanie czytasz to pole <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>pytania</span> karty.<br />Kliknij na duy przycisk poniej...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Ukazaa si nastpna karta.<br/><br/>Idea jest prosta: tak jak w &quot;prawdziwych&quot;, papierowych fiszkach, na jednej stronie karty zapisujesz pytanie, na drugiej za odpowied.<br/><br/>(kliknij przycisk, aby zobaczy drug stron)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Jak nazywa si stolica Burkina Faso?&quot;<br/><br/>Pomyl przez chwil nad odpowiedzi, nastpnie kliknij &quot;Poka odpowied&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Powyej kadego z przyciskw odpowiedzi pokazany jest czas, po jakim karta ponownie si pojawi, jeli odpowiesz na ni za pomoc tego przycisku.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Celem jest ponowne pokazanie karty tu przed jej zapomnieniem.  Badania empiryczne wykazay, e w ten sposb mona skuteczniej opanowywa materia pamiciowy.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Par sw na temat organizacji danych w AnkiDroidzie:<br /><br>Materia do nauki musi by podzielony na pary pyta i odpowiedzi.  Do nauki w drug stron naley utworzy now kart z odwrcon kolejnoci pytania i odpowiedzi.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Karty grupowane s w taliach, w ktrych mona je organizowa za pomoc przernych etykiet.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Dwie podstawowe metody pozyskiwania nowych kart: <br/><br/>Mona pobra gotowe talie innych uytkownikw (opcja &quot;Pobierz tali&quot; w menu okna talii) lub tworzy wasne.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[W kadym razie, tworzenie wasnych talii jest nieodzowne, jeli chcesz je mie idealnie dopasowane do swoich potrzeb.  Mona to robi bezporednio w AnkiDroidzie...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Spjrzmy na grn cz ekranu:<br/><br/>W lewym grnym rogu widnieje par liczb.  Czerwona wskazuje ile jest kart nieudanych (na ktre odpowiedziano \"Powtrz\"),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[W prawym rogu pokazane jest, jak dugo zajo Ci zastanawianie si nad odpowiedzi i Twoje wyniki.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[To byy najwaniejsze zasady uytkowania AnkiDroida.<br /><br>Aby dowiedzie si wicej na temat Anki, odwied http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... aby zobaczy pole <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>odpowiedzi</span> karty (poniej linii).<br /><br /><br />Kliknij na prawym z czterech przyciskw poniej]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Zamy, e chcemy nauczy si stolic rnych krajw.  Niech pytanie brzmi...<br/><br/>(kliknij na jednym z przyciskw, aby zobaczy nastpn kart)]]></item>

- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>
-</resources>

-<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> 
- <!-- 
- ~ Copyright (c) 2011 Norbert Nagold <norbert.nagold@gmail.com> 
- ~ This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under 
- ~ the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software 
- ~ Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later 
- ~ version.

- ~ WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A 
- ~ PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

- ~ You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with 
- ~ this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>. 
- -->

- 
-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>
-</resources>

- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item> 
- </string-array>
-</resources>

-<resources> 
- <string-array name="tutorial_questions"> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Thanks for installing AnkiDroid!<br />This is a short introduction.<br /><br />What you see now is the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>question</span> part of a flashcard.<br />Please click on the large button below...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The next card is shown now.<br /><br />The idea is straightforward: Just like in &quot;real world&quot; paper flashcards, you write a question on the front and the answer on the back side of your cards.<br /><br />(click the button to show the back side)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;What is the capital of Burkina Faso?&quot;<br /><br />Think a bit about the answer and click then &quot;show answer&quot;]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Above every answer buttons, you find information about the time, after which the card will be shown again when answered by this button.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The intention is to show you the card again, immediately before you would forget it. Empirical studies have shown that by this means information can be learned most efficiently.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Some words about the organisation in AnkiDroid:<br /><br>All information has to be put into pairs of question and answer. If you want to learn in the other direction, you should create another card with swapped information.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Cards are put together in decks and can there be organised by help of all sorts of tags.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[There are mainly two ways of getting new cards:<br /><br />You either download premade decks of other users (choose &quot;download deck&quot; in the deck summary\'s options menu) or create them by yourself. ]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[But anyway, creating own decks is essential to suit your needs perfectly. You can do this directly in AnkiDroid...]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s have a look on the top bar:<br /><br />In the left top corner you find some numbers. The red one counts the failed cards (answered by &quot;again&quot;),]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[On the right corner you find information about your thinking time of this card and about your performance.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[These have been the main points of AnkiDroid usage.<br /><br>For more information about the key concept of Anki, visit http://ankisrs.net/]]></item> 
- </string-array>
- <string-array name="tutorial_answers">
-    <item><![CDATA[... in order to see the <span style=\'font-weight:600;\'>answer</span> part of the flashcard (below the line).<br /><br /><br />Click on the right one of the four buttons]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Let\'s assume you want to learn the world\'s capitals. Let the question be...<br /><br />(click on one of the buttons to show the next card)]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[&quot;Ouagadougou&quot; is the right answer. <br /><br />You didn\'t know it? Click &quot;again&quot; to see the card again in a couple of minutes. Otherwise, click on the other buttons, depending on the easiness of the answer.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[This time period is calculated of the last time you answered the card, the current ease choice and ease choices of previous answers of that card.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[If you want to learn more about spaced repetition, visit:<br>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaced_repetition_system]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Don\'t worry, this can be done automatically. There is no need of inserting the same information twice.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You will learn about that quickly when you start to use AnkiDroid.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[You\'ll find thousands of premade decks to download and there are probably some which are useful for you.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[... or (a bit more convenient) with the desktop application Anki (downloadable for free under http://ankisrs.net/).<br><br>You can sync your decks with the desktop application very easily, so transfering the data is not a problem.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[the black one shows the number of cards you\'ve already learned before and which are due to review today, and the blue number tells you, how many new cards are projected for today. <br /><br />The type of the actual cards is specified by an underline.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[The upper bar shows your progress, the lower one indicates the percentage of yes answers.]]></item> 
-    <item><![CDATA[Just try it a bit out now and see, if it fits your needs.<br><br>Maybe start with the deck overview (hit menu on the main screen and choose &quot;all decks&quot;), where you can download premade decks or create your own (just use the menu there).]]></item>

-<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> 
- <!-- 
- ~ Copyright (c) 2011 Norbert Nagold <norbert.nagold@gmail.com>

- ~ the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software
